30:05 And you know, they knew the importance of coming to the table. 她们知道聚在桌前用餐的重要性
30:09 My mother would always say, "Come back to the table." 我妈生前常说：“快回到桌前吃饭”
30:12 You have to have a meal with your family before going away 离开前一定要跟家人一起吃顿饭
30:16 because it's a place where we could find 因为餐桌是我们可以找到
30:19 that comfort and spirituality. 归宿感和灵性的地方
30:22 So we came together, and we had church suppers. 所以我们一起在教堂聚餐
30:26 People of African descent are very spiritual. 非洲人后裔都非常属灵
30:30 And so we are a people who understand… 我们非裔很理解…
30:35 the need for ceremony. 仪式的重要性
30:37 I mean, it's the meals like this that is part of how it all comes together. 正是这种聚餐让一切回到原点
30:41 Ceremony is the punctuation that rhythms and rhymes 仪式是有节奏和韵律的标点符号
30:47 and defines our lives 赋予我们人生意义
30:51 and equally on the table. 餐桌前人人平等
30:53 And so the need to have ceremonies 因此出发前举办仪式
30:59 when leaving is important 是有必要的
31:01 because it's about making a transition. 因为即将经历改变
31:04 Because it took courage to head out into the unknown, 前往未知的地方需要勇气
31:09 to set, a term that Maya Angelou used to use, to set foot in path. 正如玛雅·安吉洛常说的一句话 “去开路”
31:16 Because that's what they did. They set foot in path. 这就是我们祖先做的事 他们去开路
31:19 They set their face against the wind, 逆着风
31:22 and they moved into the unknown, and that was The Great Migration. 往未知走去 这就是所谓的“大迁徙”

31:57 Black folks traveled themselves by whatever means available. 非裔使用任何触手可得的交通工具 跋涉千里
32:02 Bus, wagon, by train. 巴士、马车、火车

32:12 in luxury sleeper cars designed by inventor George Pullman 这些火车设有发明家乔治·普尔曼 所设计的豪华卧铺车厢

32:35 The wages, tips, and a Black-funded 乘务员的工资、小费 加上由非裔出资和主导的工会 为部分非裔美国人

33:01 that made the Pullman experience legendary. 造就了传奇性的普尔曼乘务体验
